channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Rush to Flee Rafah, and the Flag on Justice Alito’s Lawn
item.description: Plus, the grilling of Michael Cohen.

item.title: French Police Kill Man Who Tried to Set Rouen Synagogue on Fire
item.description: The synagogue, in Rouen, northern France, sustained “significant damage,” but nobody other than the assailant was harmed, the authorities said.

item.title: Trump lawyers accuse former fixer Michael Cohen of lying to jury
item.description: Whether the defense is successful in undermining Cohen's testimony could determine Trump's fate in the case.

item.title: When ‘Stop the Steal’ Becomes Your Motto
item.description: With or without Trump, the Republican threat to democracy remains.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: First Supplies Enter Gaza Through Pier Built by U.S. Military
item.description: It is the first humanitarian aid in months to be sent to the territory by sea. Pentagon officials said that no U.S. troops entered Gaza.

item.title: Sir Richard Branson—who hates being called a billionaire—sees net worth fall back to 2000 levels
item.description: Branson took a $126 million hit to his fortune last year as he continued to fight several fires at his Virgin Group.

item.title: Trump’s Trial Menu: What’s for Lunch?
item.description: Over the course of the last several weeks, Donald J. Trump and his legal team have lunched on fast food, sandwiches and pizzas.

item.title: Israel Defends Rafah Operation as ‘Limited and Localized’ at ICJ
item.description: Lawyers for Israel argued that the International Court of Justice should not grant a South African request to order an immediate halt to the ground assault in Rafah.

item.title: A deepfake ‘CFO’ tricked the British design firm behind the Sydney Opera House in $25 million fraud
item.description: “Our financial stability and business operations were not affected," an Arup spokesperson said.

item.title: Speculation Swirls in Slovakia, With Details About Fico Attack Scant
item.description: The authorities have released little about the attack on Prime Minister Robert Fico, about the identity of the assailant or even about who is leading the country in the interim.

item.title: Speculation Swirls in Slovakia, With Details About Fico Attack Scant
item.description: The authorities have released little about the attack on Prime Minister Robert Fico, about the identity of the assailant or even about who is leading the country in the interim.

item.title: Taiwan is now exporting and investing more in the U.S. than China in major pivot away from Beijing
item.description: The U.S. displaced mainland China as the top destination for Taiwan’s exports in the first quarter of the year for the first time since the start of 2016, when comparable data became available.

item.title: China Says It Will Start Buying Apartments as Housing Slump Worsens
item.description: Signaling growing alarm, policymakers ramped up efforts to stem a continued decline in real estate values.

item.title: As Supernatural Claims Spread Online, Vatican Updates Its Rules on Them
item.description: People have long claimed sightings of the Virgin Mary or bleeding crucifixes, and some endorsed by the Roman Catholic Church have become hugely popular pilgrimage destinations.

item.title: Nearly half of Gen Z and millennial workers have left a job, or plan to, because of climate concerns
item.description: Instead of sitting with their climate change anxiety, Gen Z and millennials are trying to save the planet by quitting jobs that aren’t eco-friendly.
